titleInfo.title: Changing cities : linking global knowledge to local action : a dialogue.

mods.abstract: The East-West Center's Asia-Pacific-U.S. Urban Dialogue examines the complex human costs of urbanization and innovative solutions for creating more liveable cities of the future. Since 2008, the program has been bringing together small, diverse groups of city leaders, policymakers, urban planners, civil society and business leaders, experts and scholars, from across Asia and the United States to share their ideas, experiences, and strategic visions. Through informal, roundtable discussions that encourage lively and frank peer-to-peer exchanges, participants come away with a deeper and common understanding of the urban challenges faced across Asia and in the West and ways to manage the urban transition
